examples: She received false advice that led to negative consequences.
I don't want to dwell on the negative aspects of our situation.
The right hand doesn't know what the left is doing, and the result is setting customers up for a negative experience.
Buying time may serve as a buffer against the negative effects of time stress in part by enhancing perceived control.
Criticizing the government for not doing enough to control the economy cuts both ways, as too much government intervention can also lead to negative consequences.
words.defineEn: having an unpleasant or harmful effect on someone or something; not having a positive effect
words.defineVi: có ảnh hưởng khó chịu hoặc có hại cho ai đó hoặc cái gì đó; không có tác dụng tích cực

examples: A new law is proposed to curb this type of blatantly dishonest description, and not before time

What a pain writing good grant descriptions can be if you don't know where to begin.
Link description to that one too.
Mathematical string theories suggest descriptions of this unification, in addition to a fundamental structure for sub-atomic quarks and electrons.
words.defineEn: a written or oral piece intended to give a mental image of something
words.defineVi: một bài viết hoặc bằng miệng nhằm đưa ra một hình ảnh tinh thần của một cái gì đó

examples: Can you read music?
The music was far too loud for my liking.
Her words were music to my ears.
Set this poem to music.
That music really gets me.
words.defineEn: a series of sounds made by instruments or voices, arranged in a way that is pleasant or exciting to listen to
words.defineVi: một loạt âm thanh được tạo ra bởi các nhạc cụ hoặc giọng nói, được sắp xếp theo cách dễ chịu hoặc thú vị để nghe

examples: The murals on the Protestant side of Northern Ireland's religious divide are less sentimental and more militaristic.
He's overly sentimental just to get attention.
But I get very sentimental when I come in here.
Russia had sentimental attachment to Serbia and therefore was opposed to Kosovo’s independence.
Live streaming a sentimental wartime song from his tent, rally organizer Nigel Marcham, nicknamed Nobby, or the little veteran.
words.defineVi: dễ bị ảnh hưởng bởi cảm xúc

examples: Her condition is very serious.
He avoided serious injury following a head-first fall on to the ice.
The thrill-seeker who skydived without proper safety precautions ended up with a serious injury.
Riding a bike without a helmet may seem like harmless fun, but it can have serious consequences.
Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
words.defineEn: bad or dangerous; significant or worrying due to a possible danger or risk
words.defineVi: xấu hoặc nguy hiểm; đáng kể hoặc đáng lo ngại do nguy hiểm hoặc rủi ro có thể xảy ra

examples: Many banks have cut commercial builders off cold turkey.

The artist refused to compromise on their vision for commercial success, understanding that no man loves his fetters, be they made of gold.
words.defineEn: related to the purchasing and selling of different goods and services
words.defineVi: liên quan đến việc mua và bán các hàng hóa và dịch vụ khác nhau

examples: I am a dated planner through and through.
words.defineEn: no longer fashionable or commonly used
words.defineVi: không còn thời trang hoặc thường được sử dụng

examples: You perform repetitive behaviors in response to the appearance concerns.
- It's a little bit repetitive.
These animals make repetitive cracking sounds that punctuate the tranquility of coral reefs.
So, start with your current repetitive relationships.
It is a common repetitive behavior of autistic children.
words.defineEn: continuously saying or doing something, in a way that it becomes unnecessary or boring
words.defineVi: liên tục nói hoặc làm điều gì đó, theo cách mà nó trở nên không cần thiết hoặc nhàm chán

examples: Interrupting others is annoying, so try to break the habit.
Interrupting others is annoying, so try to break the habit.
However, too much of a good thing can get annoying.
We finally got rid of your younger brother, he's so annoying!
Lines are super annoying.
words.defineVi: gây ra sự tức giận nhẹ

examples: The movie was as boring as they come.

I have to do the same boring jobs day in day out.
The child nodded off to sleep during the boring lecture.
This course seemed right up my alley when I signed up for it, but it ended up being dreadfully boring.
words.defineEn: making us feel tired and unsatisfied because of not being interesting
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy mệt mỏi và không hài lòng vì không thú vị

examples: This is incredibly depressing.

When I turned six years old, it was a very depressing time in my life.

The branch broke with a loud snap.
The loud noise made me jump out of my skin.
He gave a loud cry and fell to the floor.
The loud crash made everyone in the room sit up and take notice.

Upon seeing the offensive graffiti, a look of grimace crossed his face.
When I asked my grandfather how much sleep he got each night, he replied, 'six hours' sleep for a man, seven for a woman, and eight for a fool,' which I found surprising and somewhat offensive.
By 1917, they're making an offensive.
Yeah, that's very offensive.
words.defineEn: describing something that is upsetting or disrespectful
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó là khó chịu hoặc thiếu tôn trọng

examples: You’re just silly.

When his friends teased him about his silly hat, he laughed along and played along with the joke.
It was a classic example of the saying 'ask a silly question and get a silly answer.'

examples: She really is weird, unsympathetic and is useless for the better part of the movie.
